Context:
Extracted Information:
- Popular outlets at each campus include Tim Hortons, Bento Sushi, Pizza Pizza, and bar and grills operated by the Student Association.
- Microwaves can be found in campus cafeterias and Student Association areas for students bringing food from home.
- The website to visit for more dining information is chartwells.com/georgebrown.
- Cafeteria and Student Centre Lounge options with specific locations and hours are available at Building C (level 2), Building E (level 1), Building A (lower level), and Building A (fourth floor).
- SNAP registration can be done at the Casa Loma Campus, Student Association office in room 127. More details can be found on their website: studentassociation.ca.
- The weekly Good Food Market takes place at St. James Campus every Thursday from 10:30 a.m. to 3 p.m.
- Traditional café options and meals prepared by Chef School students are available at Building A (200 King St. E).
- Operating hours for the GBC Café, a student-run café with daily specials like mac and cheese, fried chicken, fish tacos, pizza, sandwiches, salads, pastries, smoothies, coffee, and tea, can be found on their Twitter account @gbccafe or by visiting dineoncampus.ca/georgebrown.
- Chef on the Run offers takeaway meals and treats with reduced hours during the summer semester. It is located at Building B (300 Adelaide St. E), main floor, Mondays to Fridays from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Where to Eat on Campus | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Chef on the Run: located at 200 King St. E., building A, room 150. Offers takeaway meals and treats with early pick-up recommended due to student-made dishes popularity. No website mentioned.
* The Chefs’ House: located at 200 King St. E., building A. Students develop and demonstrate their skills in the kitchen and dining room. Check menu and operating hours on thechefshouse.com.
* Student Association office: located at Casa Loma Campus, E building, room 127. Students can register for SNAP program here. More details available on studentassociation.ca/services/snap.
* Good Food Market: held weekly Thursdays, 10:30 a.m. - 3 p.m., at St. James Campus, 300 Adelaide St. E., atrium. Offers fresh fruits and vegetables at affordable prices.
* Phone number for George Brown College: 416-415-2000. TTY: 1-877-515-5559.
* Email address for general inquiries: ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
* Social Media Hub: available on the website but no further details provided.
* George Brown College website: dineoncampus.ca/georgebrown (for operating hours of Main floor and 7th floor).
* Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
* Land acknowledgment: more information available by signing up on the website.
* Application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours: sign up to receive updates on the website.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Where to Eat on Campus | George Brown College.txt
